    Site Configuration

    Step 1: Setting up the site

    To set-up the Site

    • Click Organisation Settings -> Organisation Info

    To add new site follow the steps given below,

    1. Enter the information for your organisation and click save

    Step 2: Adding Hirerchy for your organisation

    To add the hierarchy click Card follow the steps shown in the video below.

    • When you click "Card" a new dialouge box will appear with following option to create the hirerchy.

    • Please select the appropiate name from the list to create the parent and child levels and enter all required fields for the respective selections and click on Save Config.

    • To add the levels to the Hirerchy click on the + sign on the parent card

    `

    Shift Managment

    Shift Management allow you to set the Time of Day (or TOD) tariff structure for differnt shift in your enterprise e.g Shift1 , Shift2..etc and it also help you to assign the TOD Shift for different department in your enterprise.

    • Under shiff Management you have Shift/TOD List and Shift/TOD Group

    Shift/TOD List

    • To add new Shift/TOD click on Shift/TOD List and then click +Add

    • Select the Date, enter Start Time, End Time , enter the Name of **Time Slot ** e.g *Shift1, Provide the **discription for the same . You can also slect the Time Slot From the Group, under Next Day you would slect Yes or No this is for you would like to repeat the same for next day . under ** Apply To you can select the departmanet for which you want it to be applied.

    • Newly created shift entry will be listed in the shift/TOD list , you can edit the same by clicking on Pen Icon.

    Shift/TOD Group

    In Shift/TOD Group you can create the group for the Shift and TOD which you can use it during creating new Shift or TOD entry in the list, Click + to create new group then click save after entering the details.

    Email Settings

    The Email Settings provides all the details of the existing Email profiles. The default profile can be set. There is provision to Edit or Delete a profile under the Actions column.

    • To create a new Email Profile click on **Email Settings ** then click on +Add button.

    • These settings are for sending emails from your email provider's mail server. After furnishing the details, you can Send Test Mail to check if its working and Save the information of the newly created profile.
    ItemDescription
    Profile NameThe user-defined name of the profile is to be provided.
    Sender NameName of the Sender
    Sender EmailThe Email ID of the Sender
    UsernameThe user name of the email account
    PasswordThe password ofthe email account
    SMTP AddressThe hostname of the outgoing SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) server, such as smtp.example.com.
    SMTP PORTThe port number used by the outgoing mail server. Common port numbers for outgoing mail are 25, 465, and 587.
    SMTP Encryption ProtocolSelect the protocol from the dropdown SSL or TLS
    SMTP Authorization requiredCheck the box if SMTP authorization is required

    • Newly created email profile will be listed in the Email Settings list , you can edit the same by clicking on Pen Icon. The list displays the configuration of the Mail profile and also allows you to set the System Defauls by clicking the check box and by clicking on Delete it will remove that profile.

    SMS Settings

    An SMS settings allows a computer to send or receive Short Message Service (SMS) transmissions to a telecommunications network. These messages are eventually routed into the mobile phone networks.

    All the information required by the Service Providers to transmit this message is provided through the SMS Profile.

    The SMS Setting page provides all the details of the existing SMS profiles. The default profile can be set. There is provision to Edit or Delete a profile under the Actions column.

    • To create a new SMS Profile click on **SMS Settings ** then click on +Add button.

    ItemDescription
    Profile NameThe user-defined name of the profile is to be provided.
    URLThe URL provided by the service provider Accessed by the User is to be given in this field.
    For Mobile NumberThis is the name provided by the Service Provider subscribed by the user. This name is used as a Parameter reference for mobile numbers.
    For MessageThis is the name provided by the Service Provider subscribed by the user. This name is used as a Parameter reference for the message.
    • Apart from the above settings, depending on the Network Provider, few more inputs like Password, Sender ID, etc. might be required. To add such Parameters Click on Add Parameter button.
    • Provide the Parameter Name and Parameter Value into their respective fields.
